events.message: The customer reported an auto accident involving their vehicle at the intersection at 7:45 AM.
Based on the description, the claim was categorized under Auto Accident for appropriate processing.
An agent specializing in auto claims was assigned to handle the investigation promptly.
The customer was sent an acknowledgment email confirming receipt of the auto accident claim.
Requested copies of police report, vehicle registration, and photos of the accident damage from the claimant.
The claimant submitted the police report and photos of the damaged car to support the claim evaluation.
The agent began an investigation including interviews and review of submitted documents and photos.
Investigation confirmed the details of the accident; liability and damage extent were assessed fully.
A settlement offer for the vehicle repairs and associated costs was sent to the claimant for review.
The customer responded with some questions about the settlement but appeared generally satisfied.
After addressing feedback, the claim was officially approved for payment as per policy terms.
Payment was issued directly to the repair shop to facilitate timely repairs of the vehicle damage.
The claim was marked closed after confirmation of payment issuance and repair scheduling.
The claim files and correspondence were archived for record keeping and future reference if necessary.
